title: Bobritzsch (river)
text:
The Bobritzsch is a river of <a href="Saxony">Saxony</a>, <a href="Germany">Germany</a>. It is a right tributary of the <a href="Freiberger%20Mulde">Freiberger Mulde</a> with a length of about . Its "<a href="Gew%C3%A4sserkennzahl">Gewässerkennzahl</a>" is 5422.
Course.
The source of the river is located about south-east of <a href="Frauenstein%2C%20Saxony">Frauenstein</a> in the <a href="Eastern%20Ore%20Mountains">Eastern Ore Mountains</a>, above <a href="Hartmannsdorf-Reichenau">Hartmannsdorf-Reichenau</a> on the edge of Kreuzwald forest and from Weicheltmühle (a <a href="watermill">watermill</a>) on <a href="Gimmlitz">Gimmlitz</a> river.
The river passes through Reichenau, <a href="Frauenstein%2C%20Saxony">Kleinbobritzsch</a>, <a href="Hartmannsdorf-Reichenau">Hartmannsdorf</a>, <a href="Klingenberg%2C%20Saxony">Friedersdorf</a>, <a href="Bobritzsch-Hilbersdorf">Oberbobritzsch</a> and <a href="Bobritzsch-Hilbersdorf">Niederbobritzsch</a>, <a href="Bobritzsch-Hilbersdorf">Naundorf</a>, <a href="Halsbr%C3%BCcke">Falkenberg</a>, <a href="Halsbr%C3%BCcke">Krummenhennersdorf</a>, <a href="Reinsberg%2C%20Germany">Reinsberg</a> and <a href="Reinsberg%2C%20Germany">Bieberstein</a>.
A well-known <a href="hiking%20path">hiking path</a> along Bobritzsch river between Krummenhennersdorf and Reinsberg is called <a href="Graben%20Tour">Grabentour</a>. <a href="Reinsberg%20Castle">Reinsberg Castle</a> is located on a rock above the right bank of the river, <a href="Bieberstein%20Castle">Bieberstein Castle</a> above its left bank.
Bobritzsch river joins Freiberger Mulde between Reinsberg and <a href="Siebenlehn">Siebenlehn</a>, north of Bieberstein castle.
Origin of the name.
The name of the river originates from Old <a href="Sorbian%20languages">Sorbian</a> "Bobrica", derived from "bobr" (<a href="Eurasian%20beaver">beaver</a>), and signifies a water course where beavers lived.
